title: Ticket #42: Altera ProcD performance problem
description:
From condor-users: 
Matt, I backed out of my 7.0.x -> 7.2.0 upgrade plan here at Altera but
it wasn't because the binaries were non-functional. The new procd daemon
that takes care of thread clean up and improves privledge separation (or
so the readme says) takes *forever* to kill off a job when a claim
preempts a running job and it was causing havoc with our preemption
policy. I haven't had a chance to try 7.2.0 out with the no-procd option
yet to see if things are sane.

  - Ian
We should contact Ian and try to figure out and fix his issue.
remarks:
2009-Jan-20 08:43:17 by gquinn:
I've sent Ian e-mail in order to get moving on this.

2009-Jan-21 09:27:26 by tannenba:
This sounds very easy to reproduce. Let's not wait for Ian to send us back info/logs if we can easily reproduce the problem here.

2009-Jan-23 10:17:42 by gquinn:
Ben has tried to reproduce this to no avail. I sent out an e-mail to condor-users saying that we are working with Altera on this and we've tried to reproduce it unsuccessfully, and also asking whether any other users are experiencing it. No responses yet.

2009-Mar-27 13:04:20 by burnett:
"Ben, sorry for the insane delay on this. Before I ripped apart my system to institute the hooks-based system I tried it out with 7.2.1.

I couldn't reproduce the problem. The preemption was occurring fast on Windows and my preemption-based policy was working. The request_claim_timeout timer was never timing out.

- Ian"
creator: gquinn
